title: iQOO Neo10R is coming
description: The iQOO Neo10 and Neo10 Pro went official in China last week, and now there's already talk of a third member joining the family soon - sort of. The iQOO Neo10R is coming to India in the near future, according to a tipster on X. It will be offered in three RAM/storage combos: 8/128GB, 8/256GB, and 12/256GB. He also claims there is a "high chance" that this will be a rebranded iQOO Neo10, even though that doesn't make any sense to us - do Indians love the letter "R" enough that it needs to be added to the name of the original like that? iQOO Neo10 Anyway, supposing this pans out...
excerpt: Some details have been outed. The iQOO Neo10 and Neo10 Pro went official in China last week, and now there's already talk of a third member joining the...
text: The iQOO Neo10 and Neo10 Pro went official in China last week, and now there's already talk of a third member joining the family soon - sort of. The iQOO Neo10R is coming to India in the near future, according to a tipster on X. It will be offered in three RAM/storage combos: 8/128GB, 8/256GB, and 12/256GB. He also claims there is a "high chance" that this will be a rebranded iQOO Neo10, even though that doesn't make any sense to us - do Indians love the letter "R" enough that it needs to be added to the name of the original like that? iQOO Neo10Anyway, supposing this pans out (and that's a pretty substantial bet), note that the Chinese Neo10 comes with a 6.78-inch 1,260x2,800 LTPO AMOLED screen with 144 Hz refresh rate and 4,500-nit peak brightness, the Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 SoC at the helm, a 50 MP main camera with OIS, an 8 MP ultrawide, a 16 MP selfie snapper, and a 6,100 mAh battery with support for 120W fast wired charging. We'll let you know when any other details about the Neo10R surface. Source
html:
The iQOO Neo10 and Neo10 Pro went official in China last week, and now there's already talk of a third member joining the family soon - sort of. The iQOO Neo10R is coming to India in the near future, according to a tipster on X.

It will be offered in three RAM/storage combos: 8/128GB, 8/256GB, and 12/256GB. He also claims there is a "high chance" that this will be a rebranded iQOO Neo10, even though that doesn't make any sense to us - do Indians love the letter "R" enough that it needs to be added to the name of the original like that?

iQOO Neo10

Anyway, supposing this pans out (and that's a pretty substantial bet), note that the Chinese Neo10 comes with a 6.78-inch 1,260x2,800 LTPO AMOLED screen with 144 Hz refresh rate and 4,500-nit peak brightness, the Snapdragon 8 Gen 3 SoC at the helm, a 50 MP main camera with OIS, an 8 MP ultrawide, a 16 MP selfie snapper, and a 6,100 mAh battery with support for 120W fast wired charging.

We'll let you know when any other details about the Neo10R surface.

Source
